title: How to Change a Window

steps.headline: Calculate the dimensions of the existing window precisely with the tape-measure.
steps.description: Get an alternative window that is a bit smaller, so that it will certainly fit nicely in the framework.

steps.headline: Remove the sashes.
steps.description: Unscrew or pry off the sashes. Having a flat pry bar pry off the jamb liner. Then you'll have to prepare the actual shape.

steps.headline: Scrape off lose or blistered paint.
steps.description: Patch up holes or splits in the frame with wooden putty. Sand the framework making use of sand papers.

steps.headline: Close off the window framework with silicone caulk.
steps.description: Apply two continuous beads of silicone caulk to along the entire sill.

steps.headline: Spot the actual replacement window.
steps.description: Establish the lower edge of the window in place first, after that tip the frame upright and into place.

steps.headline: Make use of wooden shims as required at the bottom of the window as well as besides the side jambs to make sure the window is centered.
steps.description: Make sure there's enough room to open and close the shims readily.

steps.headline: Fasten the window securely with screws.
steps.description: Trim off shim flush with a utility knife.

steps.headline: Fill up the gaps between the window frame and the jamb using low expansion foam.
To make a watertight seal around the outside, stuff foam backer rod into the remaining gap with a putty knife.
steps.description: Seal the tiny gaps with silicone caulk.

steps.headline: Prime and paint the window sash as well as frame.
